rdfs:label: Data Governance Taxonomy
rdfs:comment: SKOS Concept Scheme to work alongside Data Governance Scheme and provide commonly used taxonomies for Systems, Controls and Transformations.

skos:prefLabel: Data Processing by Level of Automation

skos:definition: Processing according to a predefined algorithm explicitly coded in some programming language.
Processing according to an adaptive algorithm that does not have to be coded explicitly(e.g. an ML or AI model).
Enactment of the control that can be classified by the actor performing it (manual versus automated) and by the goal (preventative versus detective).
The degree to which data is error free and aligns with what it represents.
Accessibility and usability of data when required.
The extent to which data is not missing and is of sufficient breadth and depth for the intended purpose.
The degree to which related data is in alignment with respect to dimensions such as definition, value, range, type and format, as applicable.
The degree to which data is relevant, appropriate for the intended purpose and meets business specifications.
The degree to which data is up-to-date.
Data Element that, if of insufficient quality, materially impacts the ability of the organisation to achieve its objectives, manage risk or meet regulatory obligations.
